scola.Scola¶

class Scola(path_to_working_directory)¶

Scola algorithm

An algorithm to construct networks from correlaton matrices

__init__(path_to_working_directory)¶
Parameters:path_to_working_directory (string) – Path to the working directory. All results will be saved in this directory. If the directory does not exist, the program will create the directory.

Methods

__init__(path_to_working_directory)
Parameters:path_to_working_directory (string) – Path to the working directory.
construct_network(C_samp, L[, null_model, …]) Construct a network from a correlation matrix
get_network() Get the generated network
get_null_corr_matrix() Get the null correlation matrix
construct_network(C_samp, L, null_model='config', lambda_list=array([1.00000000e+00, 4.52035366e-01, 2.04335972e-01, 9.23670857e-02, 4.17531894e-02, 1.88739182e-02, 8.53167852e-03, 3.85662042e-03, 1.74332882e-03, 7.88046282e-04, 3.56224789e-04, 1.61026203e-04, 7.27895384e-05, 3.29034456e-05, 1.48735211e-05, 6.72335754e-06, 3.03919538e-06, 1.37382380e-06, 6.21016942e-07, 2.80721620e-07, 1.26896100e-07, 5.73615251e-08, 2.59294380e-08, 1.17210230e-08, 5.29831691e-09, 2.39502662e-09, 1.08263673e-09, 4.89390092e-10, 2.21221629e-10, 1.00000000e-10]), beta=0.5, disp=True)¶

Construct a network from a correlation matrix

Parameters:
  • C_samp (numpy.matrix) (Pearson correlation matrix for the input data.)
  • L (int) (Number of samples.)
  • null_model (string; Optional; Default = “config”) (Name of null model. See the Readme for the available null models.)
  • lambda_list (numpy.array; Optinal; Default = numpy.logspace(-10, 0, 30)[::-1]) – The lasso penalties. The algorithm will generate networks with the given lasso penalties. Then, it outputs the network that minimises the extended BIC.
  • beta (float. Optional. Default = 0.5. 0 <= beta <=1) (Parameter of the extended BIC. Larger beta would yield a sparser network.)
  • disp (boolean; Optional; Default=True) (Set to True to print the progress.)
Returns:

  • W (numpy.matrix) (Weighted adjacency matrix of the constructed network.)
  • EBIC (float) (The value of the extended Bayesian Information Criterion.)
  • lam (float) (The vaue of the lasso penalty that yields the minimum EBIC value among those in lambda_list.)
get_network()¶

Get the generated network

Returns:W – Weighted adjacency matrix of the constructed network.
Return type:NxN numpy.matrix
get_null_corr_matrix()¶

Get the null correlation matrix

Returns:Cnull – Null correlation matrix.
Return type:NxN numpy.matrix
